# makeFunction(descriptor:)

**Instance Method**

Synchronously creates an object representing a shader function, using the specified descriptor.

## Declaration

```swift
func makeFunction(descriptor: MTLFunctionDescriptor) throws -> any MTLFunction
```

## Parameters

- **descriptor**: The description of the function object to create.

## Return Value

A new [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunction] instance if the method finds the function in the library; otherwise Swift throws an error and Objective-C returns `nil`.

## Creating shader function instances

- **makeFunction(name:)**: Creates an instance that represents a shader function in the library.
- **makeFunction(name:constantValues:completionHandler:)**: Asynchronously creates a specialized shader function.
- **makeFunction(name:constantValues:)**: Synchronously creates a specialized shader function.
- **makeFunction(descriptor:completionHandler:)**: Asynchronously creates an object representing a shader function, using the specified descriptor.
